properties.areaDesc: Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains
properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 4 at 2:34PM CST until February 5 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of
3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. A Blizzard
Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or
occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor
visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions,
making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get
stranded, stay with your vehicle.

* WHERE...Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains in Texas.

* WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Falling
and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are
likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel
extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must travel, have a
winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with
your vehicle.
properties.instruction:
Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 800-452-
9292.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY
